result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Alan E Castell was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other revocation associated with this accident

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. (Bond applied).

DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan.
AODA Assessment and comply treatment recommendations. Agent can accept the DOT assessment if deemed appropriate.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

Court will allow Defendant to transfer Probation to Wood County.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Participate in any other assessments as recommended by the agent.

timeConds.notes:
Good time.
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
Part of sentence may be served on electronic monitor program, the part that exceeds the 180 days.

Transfer of sentence to Wood County is acceptable if arrangements can be made.
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan E Castell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan E Castell in court with attorney Elizabeth m Majerus. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:35 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

This matter is before the Court on a sentencing for a OWI 5th.
Parties are ready to proceed.

Court has received the pretrial supervision program report that was dated 11/18.
State received a copy.
Atty Majerus also received a copy.

Neither party wish to present evidence.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing, this is a joint recommendation.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Majerus addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Majerus reads letter written by Defendant, for the record.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has reviewed criminal complaint, heard arguments by counsel and has reviewed the supervision report. 
Court believes the plea agreement and joint recommendation is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 months
Court will allow Defendant to transfer Probation to Wood County
Conditions:
Jail sentence of 300 days, good time
Jail credit for 1 day
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Part of sentence may be served on electronic monitor program, the part that exceeds the 180 days
First 180 days in custody, remaining days may be served on electronic monitor if qualified by assessment of Sheriff's Department
May serve in Wood County if arrangements can be made and if Defendant wants this
Transfer of sentence to Wood County is acceptable if arrangements can be made
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay a $1,800 fine plus costs, totaling $3,214
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Drivers License Revoked 36 Months, concurrent with any other revocation associated with this incident
IID 33 Months
DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan
AODA Assessment and comply treatment recommendations. Agent can accept the DOT assessment if deemed appropriate
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Participate in any other assessments as recommended by the agent

Defendant Alan E Castell in court with attorney Elizabeth M Majerus.  Cass Cousins appeared for the Portage County.
Cases heard today are 15TR1764 and 15CF259.

3:29 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Cousins indicates that they would request a separate sentencing date with no PSI requested.
Atty Majerus would like the Judgment of Conviction withheld as defendant is not to be sentenced as of today's date.
Atty Cousins to Amend the Information and Atty Majerus has no objection to the amendment of the information.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF259:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - Dismissed

15TR1764:
Count 1 - Dismissed

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF259 and Count 2 is Dismissed and Count 1 of 15TR1764 is Dismissed.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.


BY THE COURT:
Sentencing to be held at a later date.
Bond previously set is continued.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Alan E Castell in court with attorney Elizabeth m Majerus. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment: 
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
For OWI pursuant to Wis. Stat. 968.12

Defendant Alan E Castell in court with attorney Elizabeth m Majerus. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of OWI - 5th.
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement/right to remain silent. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

State requests a $3,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Defendant makes statements. 
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/20/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
